value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #05: Remove table filters
value.excerpt: Don't remove filters from tables when you want to remove column filters. Learn the difference and fix your DAX formulas! How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function:

value.title: CALCULATE in DAX #06: Using ALLSELECTED
value.excerpt: Learn how to correctly use ALLSELECTED in CALCULATE to compare a number with visual totals. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt CALCULATE function: https://dax.guide/calculate/?aff=yt

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Tabular models (including Power BI) require marking the Date table as a date table to get appropriate results with time intelligence calculations. This video explains why this setting is required. Article and download: https://sql.bi/670749
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/hrhEjg9yYvE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Understanding the difference between LASTDATE and MAX in DAX
value.excerpt: This video explains why in many cases, MAX should be used instead of LASTDATE to search for the last date in a time period using DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/673766?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xZyJlgE1RsI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Using OR conditions between slicers in DAX
value.excerpt: How to implement a logical OR condition between two slicers of a Power BI report, or of a PivotTable in Excel. By default, when relying on more than one slicer they are considered in an AND condition. This video+article explains how to change this behavior using DAX.  Article and sample download: https://sql.bi/66373?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/l5JX3G5Ntzk" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Add DAX calculation groups to Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: Learn how you can add many similar measures to your model.

value.title: Write DAX formulas for Power BI Desktop models
value.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn how to write DAX formulas to create calculated tables, calculated columns, and measures, which are different types of model calculations. Additionally, you'll learn how to write and format DAX formulas, which consist of expressions that use functions, operators, references to model objects, constants, and variables.

value.title: Dynamic Rolling Average with DAX in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a dynamic 7 day or 30 day rolling average wiht DAX What-IF parameters with ease. Create a dynmaic dashboard board that provides immedicate insight.   Check me out on Linkedin: www.linkedin.com/in/gaelimholland

value.title: DAX Fridays! #14: SUMMARIZE
value.excerpt: Learn how to use the function SUMMARIZE in DAX/ Powerpivot.  The function SUMMARIZE can return a summary of sales grouped around the calendar year and the product category name, this result table allows you to do analysis over the reseller sales by year and product category.  Source:https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/gg492171.aspx
